erpQuoteTool

Class ERPQuoteTool

  • java.lang.Object
    • erpQuoteTool.ERPQuoteTool

  • public class ERPQuoteTool
extends java.lang.Object

    JavaDoc Test

    The ERPQuoteTool class is a mock up quote generator for the Epik company. The prices here are not actual prices and this is meant to be a type of what could be used as a tool to help generate quotes for potential customers on products and services they need.

    Created: February 25th, 2020

    Author:
    Cameron Hiatt

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ERPQuoteTool() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int[] calculateIndependentQuote(int[] services, int contract)
      The calculateIndependentQuote method does a calculation based on independent business prices to decide what unit is needed to provide the services requested, that unit's cost, the price that each service will add up to monthly, and the total cost at the end of the determined contract length that includes both unit price and the total of all payments made during the contract.
      static int[] calculatePremiumQuote(int[] services, int contract)
      The calculatePremiumQuote method does a calculation based on premium prices to decide what unit is needed to provide the services requested, that unit's cost, the price that each service will add up to monthly, and the total cost at the end of the determined contract length that includes both unit price and the total of all payments made during the contract.
      static void independentCustomer()
      The independentCustomer method prompts the user for information based on their answer given in the main method.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      static void premiumCustomer()
      The premiumCustomer method prompts the user for information based on their answer given in the main method.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • premiumCustomer

        public static void premiumCustomer()
        The premiumCustomer method prompts the user for information based on their answer given in the main method. The main difference in this method from future methods is that it calls a specific calculation method for a premium quote rather than an independent business quote. 
        Example: premiumCustomer();

      • calculatePremiumQuote

        public static int[] calculatePremiumQuote(int[] services,
                                          int contract)
        The calculatePremiumQuote method does a calculation based on premium prices to decide what unit is needed to provide the services requested, that unit's cost, the price that each service will add up to monthly, and the total cost at the end of the determined contract length that includes both unit price and the total of all payments made during the contract. It returns an array containing this information. 
        Example: calculatePremiumQuote({1, 3, 5, 7, 0, 0, 0, 8}, 3) returns {2100, 115, 6240}
        Parameters:
        services - (int array, these correspond with different services offered that the user chose earlier.)
        contract - (int, this is a number representing one of 5 possible contract lengths for the services required.)
        Returns:
        result (int array, this is an array containing unit cost, monthly payment amount, and total cost of contract.)

      • independentCustomer

        public static void independentCustomer()
        The independentCustomer method prompts the user for information based on their answer given in the main method. The main difference in this method from future methods is that it calls a specific calculation method for an independent quote rather than an premium business quote. 
        Example: independentCustomer();

      • calculateIndependentQuote

        public static int[] calculateIndependentQuote(int[] services,
                                              int contract)
        The calculateIndependentQuote method does a calculation based on independent business prices to decide what unit is needed to provide the services requested, that unit's cost, the price that each service will add up to monthly, and the total cost at the end of the determined contract length that includes both unit price and the total of all payments made during the contract. It returns an array containing this information. 
        Example: calculateIndependentQuote({1, 3, 5, 7, 0, 0, 0, 8}, 3) returns {2600, 165, 8540}
        Parameters:
        services - (int array, these correspond with different services offered that the user chose earlier.)
        contract - (int, this is a number representing one of 5 possible contract lengths for the services required.)
        Returns:
        result (int array, this is an array containing unit cost, monthly payment amount, and total cost of contract.)
